post.author: 이진경
post.content:
MANAGER, Implementation Team
Environment and Energy

18-month temporary assignment
$65268.00 - $81784.00 / annually

Location: London
Area of Search:

The Ministry of the Environment and Energy seeks a motivated, highly skilled manager to plan, develop and position the ministry to deliver the compliance and enforcement program of the nutrient management act. Working in partnership with Ministry of Agriculture and Food and through consultative process with numerous diverse parties, you will manage the development/implementation of operational policies, regulatory procedures, monitoring/reporting processes, knowledge transfer and establishment of performance measures that will affect farming practices and rural communities throughout Ontario.

Qualifications: demonstrated expertise in management; project-management skills to manage staff, deliver multi-faceted program with province-wide impacts in designated time frames; knowledge of environmental pollutants, pollutant control, farming practices, water resources management, nutrient management with focus on biosolids, manure; excellent consultative, mediation, communication skills to build/maintain partnerships, links; excellent conceptual skills; judgment; initiative; analytical, problem- solving skills; experience using related computer systems/applications.


Apply by Jun 07, 2002 to: File EN-384/SW, Ministry of the Environment, Human Resources Branch, 40 St. Ave. W., 5th Fl., Toronto, ON M4V 1M2. Fax: 416-314-9313. E-mail: moe-postings@ene.gov.on.ca.
post.title: MANAGER, Implementation Team
